oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Robbins Brothers Circus, Nashville, Tennessee, 1938 August
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A mother and child buying a balloon from a circus man with amputated legs at the Robbins Brothers Circus in Nashville, Tennessee, August 1938. The famous Robbins Circus, elephants, bareback riders, clowns and all, arrived in Nashville on Sunday August 28th and set up for the big show Monday and the parade Monday morning. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Circus--Tennessee--Nashville
